This module implements the web worker.

Compile Options:

OptionDescriptionDefault
-d:pon2.workerfilename=<str>File name of the web worker.worker.min.js

Outline of the processing flow:

  1. The main file launches the web worker by newWorker().
  2. The main file assigns the handler that executed after the task is done by Worker.completeHandler=().
  3. The main file makes the worker do the task by Worker.run(). The task is implemented in the worker file by assignToWorker().
  4. The handler is executed.

Types

Worker = ref object
  running*: bool
Web worker. 
WorkerCompleteHandler = (returnCode: WorkerReturnCode, messages: seq[string]) ->
    void
Handler executed after the WorkerTask completed. 
WorkerReturnCode {.pure.} = enum
  Success = "success", Failure = "failure"
Return code of the worker task. 
WorkerTask = seq[string] ->
    tuple[returnCode: WorkerReturnCode, messages: seq[string]]
Task executed in a new thread.

DefaultWorkerCompleteHandler: WorkerCompleteHandler = :anonymous_2281701480
DefaultWorkerTask: WorkerTask = :anonymous_2281701423

proc run(self: Worker; args: varargs[string]) {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Runs the task and sends the message to the caller of the worker.
